alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:22PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN BIG HORN AND EAST CENTRAL YELLOWSTONE COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 421 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Worden, or 27 miles northeast of Billings, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pompeys Pillar. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
